name: damagingly
content:

in a way that causes harm: Most damagingly for workers, their living standards are falling because prices are rising more quickly than wages. Ready-to-eat sandwiches sometimes contain damagingly high levels of salt.
More examplesFewer examplesThere are cases where paid work during term cuts damagingly into students' academic time.Damagingly, ministers have lost control of the argument.Tax rates may have to stay damagingly high for the next few years.Critics have described the government's decision as damagingly short-sighted.
